info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 8:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 845 PM MDT... At 814 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge to 9 miles southwest of Dexter. Movement was west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Roswell Correctional Facility and Midway. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 89 and 122. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
